nodes.bodyText: Do users have a good way of knowing the name of the custom that should be removed? I.e. snapshot_lifecycle here.

@@ -407,6 +429,33 @@ You can also use wildcards to remove multiple settings, for example using
 node$ ./bin/elasticsearch-node remove-settings xpack.monitoring.*
 ----
 
+[float]
+==== Removing custom metadata from the cluster state
+
+If the on-disk cluster state contains custom metadata that prevents the node
+from starting up and loading the cluster state, you can run the following
+commands to remove this custom metadata.
+
+[source,txt]
+----
+node$ ./bin/elasticsearch-node remove-customs snapshot_lifecycle

nodes.bodyText: This API is expert-level, not to be used to remove random stuff. I think the name here will be provided by us for specific support cases where we have previously seen a parse exception. Note that ES still has another way to remove the metadata, namely uninstalling the plugin that defines the corresponding metadata (we just drop the metadata at load time then).

nodes.bodyText: Should we document that this uses wildcards, e.g. that * will remove all customs?

This is documented, with the docs saying

The tool takes a list of custom metadata names as parameters that should be removed, and also supports wildcard patterns.

I don't expect this to be used much, it's more to drop everything as last resort.
